STBLKeyStringList.Text: This floor level is Dusty! It feels lived-in and homey, and Sims will build relationships faster and enjoy cleaning more. If Sims make no effort to clean up a little though, this floor will become Dirty...
The floor level is Filthy! Sims will be very uncomfortable, especially with Filth Fiends invading their space! The good news is, there's nowhere to go but up, but only if you clean up.
This floor level is Clean! The sparkling surroundings fill Sims with focus, inspiration, and energy. Keep up the good work, or else your home will become Dusty.

This floor level is Dirty! Sims may start having some social troubles, and some interactions may take longer to do while your Sims are distracted by the mess. If no measures are taken, the floor will become Filthy!
(From happily cleaning in a dusty floor)
(From cleaning or vacuuming on a floor already clean)
(From continuing to clean while on a clean floor level)
(From deep cleaning on a Filthy floor level)
(From continuing to clean while already in a rage)

{0.SimFirstName} befriended a Dust Bunny! Since {M0.he}{F0.she} made {M0.his}{F0.her} fluffy companion feel so welcomed and cared for in {M0.his}{F0.her} house, this dust bunny will behave a bit differently. It can now survive in even the cleanest environments and will no longer be destroyed by cleaning around the house - it's here to stay. \n\nBefriended Dust Bunnies will also show their appreciation by finding rarer items and occasionally even digging up substantial piles of Simoleons.
(From destroying a cute, helpless dust bunny)
(From trying to pet a Filth Fiend)
(From trying to Step On a Filth Fiend and chickening out)
(From having visitors over while the house is dirty or filthy)
(From Power Cleaning as a Fast & Fastidious Sim)
What a great find! {0.SimFirstName} was gifted a cool collectible by {M0.his}{F0.her} resourceful dust friend!
{1.ObjectName} burrowed around in the dust and returned with an insect. Check your inventory to collect this crawling critter!
This Dust Bunny was so happy with {0.SimFirstName} that it managed to find lost Simoleons all over the house! {1.Money} has been added to household.

{0.SimFirstName}'s dust friend did not feel particularly motivated or happy, but did manage to half-heartedly rustle up a few Simoleons. {1.Money} has been added to household. Perhaps a little bribery in the form of dust snacks might encourage {M0.his}{F0.her} dusty friend to search a bit more industriously...
{0.SimFirstName} just received a handy upgrade part from {M0.his}{F0.her} burrowing dust bunny. You've got one useful bundle of fluff and dust on your hands!

{0.SimFirstName} may have asked for valuables, but sometimes a Dust Bunny's definition of treasure is indeed literal trash. Clearly there's some kind of failure to communicate here. Try speaking in a language your dust friend might understand better - feeding your bunny a dust snack might be a good start.
{1.ObjectName} managed to find quite a rare collectible! This bunny must really love {0.SimFirstName}!

{1.ObjectName} could certainly have looked a bit harder for something more enticing. Try keeping this Dust Bunny a bit happier and maybe it will feel motivated to scrounge up some fresher grub next time.
{1.ObjectName} found a dust-covered toy hidden in the household clutter! Who knows how long that toy had been lost!
{1.ObjectName} scrounged up a particularly tasty looking tidbit for {0.SimFirstName}. Nevermind where it came from, this offering means your dust friend must really care about you!
This Dust Bunny didn't exactly hit the jackpot, but it did manage to scrounge up a few Simoleons that had been covered up by a layer of clutter and dust. {1.Money} have been added to household.
{1.ObjectName} dug through heaps of dust to find a mysteriously pristine fruit or vegetable - and even managed to refrain from chomping into it!

{0.SimFirstName}'s dust bunny quickly returned empty-pawed, clearly having put minimal effort into actually finding anything. Perhaps a dusty snack or a caring cuddle might encourage {1.ObjectName} to try a bit harder.
{1.ObjectName} was feeling cranky and searched far and wide for something that would suitably express its grumpiness - a rotting bit of fruit or vegetable matter covered in dust. Bun Appétit!

{1.ObjectName} found some rusty upgrade parts hidden around the house. While it's not exactly treasure, the fact that {0.SimFirstName} has managed to harness the destructive energy of a filth fiend for something productive is a testament to {M0.his}{F0.her} mischief-managing skills!

Jackpot! Who knew Filth Fiends could be so resourceful? They may not seem friendly, but with enough care and love, {0.SimFirstName} found a way to bond with {M0.his}{F0.her} filth-dwelling friend. {1.Money} were found around the house and have been added to your household funds.

There's no telling how long this meal has been rotting away, but it's clear that {1.ObjectName} was proud to excavate it from the filthy floors and present it to {0.SimFirstName}. This putrid meal can be found in {0.SimFirstName}'s inventory if {M0.he}{F0.she} is feeling particularly brave.

{1.ObjectName} set off somewhat grumpily to rustle up clutter and returned with a piece of garbage. Knowing how much filth fiends love their trash and clutter, this could be interpreted as a sign that your fiend was trying to please you.

{1.ObjectName} may be filled with dastardly intent most of the time, but {0.SimFirstName} saw through this fiend's filthy exterior and found a friend. And when a fiend uses its craftiness to find cool things instead of creating chaos, it turns out they can find some pretty rare and valuable stuff. Check your inventory to see the rare collectible that {1.ObjectName} dug up!

{0.SimFirstName} has clearly done a good job pacifying {M0.his}{F0.her} filth fiends, because {1.ObjectName} just rummaged up a nifty collectible! {1.ObjectName} might be a noxious ball of grime and discontent most of the time, but with the right combination of bribery, begging, and luck, a fiend can be an asset to a household.

{0.SimFirstName} has become one with the filth and finds solace in the familiar presence of dirt and grime. As {0.SimFirstName} learned to let messes pile up and live it up, {M0.he}{F0.she} found enlightment. Why bother cleaning when things will just get dirty again? Why hold yourself to some impossible standard of cleanliness? Once {0.SimFirstName} embraced and accepted her filthy ways, {M0.he}{F0.she} realized {M0.he}{F0.she} was free - and on this day, a Filth Dweller was born.
This Sim revels in filthy, messy homes and avoids cleaning at all costs. Procrastinate, dodge chores, lower your standards, and find creative ways to thrive in the filthiest environments!

{0.SimFirstName} has scrubbed tirelessly, vacuumed voraciously, and mastered the art of maintaining a clean, perfect home. Keeping a pristine property has taught {M0.him}{F0.her} to form good daily habits, but more importantly, to truly enjoy the satisfying feeling that comes from each shined floor and scrubbed surface. {0.SimFirstName}'s reward isn't just {M0.his}{F0.her} deep knowledge of cleaning techniques or exquisite vacuum handling skills -- {M0.his}{F0.her} reward is the attitude {M0.he}{F0.she} developed along the way.

This Sim likes their home to be presentable and clean all the time. Taking pride in their pristine homes, these Sims shoot for perfection and thrive when they have a spotless house to show off to guests.
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling as fresh and clean as the room {M0.he}{F0.she}'s in. Romance sounds a lot better when everyone can enjoy a dust-free ambiance.
Obviously, the best way to keep a clean house is to clean before it gets dirty. As {0.SimFirstName} keeps cleaning, {F0.her}{M0.his} desire for a perfectly clean house will get stronger...
{0.SimFirstName}'s focus intensifies. Messes will be terminated, floors will be shined, and dust won't stand a chance!

{0.SimFirstName} has laser-like focus and every speck of dust will soon get its comeuppance! The more {M0.he}{F0.she} cleans, the more satisfying it feels. Looking around at this sparkling ode to cleanliness, {0.SimFirstName} feels unstoppable - but why stop now?

{0.SimFirstName} is no longer just a Sim. {F0.She}{M0.He} has become a cleaning machine! {F0.Her}{M0.His} surroundings were clean a long time ago, but now, everything has been double shined, triple polished, and cleaned to perfection!
It's not you, {0.SimFirstName}, it's just hard to feel the vibes when there's dust sticking to my feet and a vaguely musty scent emanating from everywhere around me.

{0.SimFirstName} has visitors and the place is a mess! {M0.He}{F0.She} explained that they just happened to come "in between cleanings" and the guests nodded politely, but somehow {0.SimFirstName} still feels judged.
Cleaning when there's a light covering of dust on furniture and floors is surprisingly enjoyable. Before the mess builds up, busting the dust feels like more of a fun pastime than a chore.

When things are this messy, the only thing to do is to channel that anger and not stop cleaning until the job is done. {0.SimFirstName} has procrastinated long enough, and now, the day of reckoning has come. Fueled by the herculean task ahead, {0.SimFirstName} will resist distractions and have no need of rest - the rage clean is building.

{0.SimFirstName}'s cleaning rage intensifies. It started with the floors. But what's the point of clean floors if the baseboards are dirty? And if {M0.he}{F0.she} cleans the floors, and leaves the counters dirty, won't the scraps of counter-debris soon wind up on the floor anyway, ruining all of {M0.his}{F0.her} work? With each cleaned room, {0.SimFirstName}'s temper gets a little hotter, {M0.his}{F0.her} voice gets a little more exasperated, and {M0.his}{F0.her} grip on the cleaning weapon of choice becomes tighter. No rest until the job's done!

Approach with caution and definitely avoid making a mess in the area {0.SimFirstName} just cleaned - {M0.he}{F0.she} has worked {M0.himself}{F0.herself} into a rage beyond rage, a cleaning fury beyond compare. The finish line is in sight and {0.SimFirstName} has slayed fiends, busted dust, and scrubbed until the walls and floors trembled in fear of {M0.his}{F0.her} superhuman cleaning power. \n\nNow who made that fingerprint mark on the wall? Whose sock is that on the floor! Is that an ant?!?!

{0.SimFirstName} was ordered to clean rather rudely, as though {M0.he}{F0.she} doesn't pull {M0.his}{F0.her} weight around the house. {M0.He}{F0.She} totally does her share of cleaning chores... just yesterday {M0.he}{F0.she} cleaned the... Nevermind! Fine!
Do I look like your maid? How about a "please" and "thank you" around here? {0.SimFirstName} may have been willing to help with cleaning if {M0.he}{F0.she} was asked nicely, but now we'll never know.

{0.SimFirstName} feels invigorated and inspired by {M0.his}{F0.her} sparkling clean surroundings! Being in a well-cared for environment will help {0.SimFirstName} be more productive and creative in many different pursuits. As long as {M0.he}{F0.she} keeps things clean, {M0.he}{F0.she} will be more successful at working from home and learning new skills.

{0.SimFirstName} can't touch anything around {M0.him}{F0.her} without encountering a layer of dust. It's getting harder to ignore the build up - things are getting dusty, crusty, and musty. Even the air feels heavier with undesirable particles. It will be harder to cook or be productive in these surroundings - but non-fussy Sims who prefer not to clean could certainly learn to get comfortable. After all, it could certainly be worse...

A light sheen of dust enhances the cosy, lived-in feel of {0.SimFirstName}'s home. It's not too clean or too messy, it's just right. These natural, homey surroundings will help Sims feel comfortable with each other, build relationships, have fun together, and feel socially nourished.

{0.SimFirstName}'s surroundings have become filthy! The floors are caked in dust and grime, and even the air feels noxious. Heaps of filth are stacking up, notorious filth fiends are running rampant, and {0.SimFirstName} is feeling overwhelmed by the mounting messes. Starting to clean in these conditions will be a tiresome task - and the thought of cooking or creating anything in such a filthy environment feels pretty unappetizing.

Where others saw clumps of pesky dust, {0.SimFirstName} saw a friend in need of attention and nurturing. Dusty floors may come and go, but {0.SimFirstName} and {M0.his}{F0.her} dust bunny are officially BFFs!

By feeding and petting a Dust Bunny, {0.SimFirstName} is keeping {M0.his}{F0.her} household dust friends as happy as possible. They might still be balls of dust, lint, hair, and debris held together by static electricity and magic, but they can also be contributing members of {0.SimFirstName}'s cozy home.
{0.SimFirstName} lost a friend today. As {M0.he}{F0.she} mourns {M0.his}{F0.her} dearly departed dust friend, hopefully the marginally cleaner floors will provide some small solace.
{0.SimFirstName} considered approaching the Filth Fiend, but {M0.he}{F0.she} reconsidered after getting closer and receiving a menacing glare. Some creatures are best observed from afar.

Filth and anarchy ruled the {0.SimLastName} household until {0.SimFirstName} fearlessly destroyed a Filth Fiend. {M0.he}{F0.she} feels a burst of renewed hope and energy, as the mischievous, mess-making fiends seem less menacing today. The carpets and floors may still be covered in grime and leftover fiend dust, but it's nothing that a cleaning champion like {0.SimFirstName} can't handle.

Fast & Fastidious Sims don't play around when it comes to cleaning. They aren't here to tidy up, they aren't interested in "dusting" - they are here to blast any manner of filth off of the face of the planet.

{0.SimFirstName} is going on a vacuuming kick and has no plans of ceasing {M0.his}{F0.her} relentless assault on the dust occupying {M0.his}{F0.her} home. Spurred on by a fresh burst of energy and focus, {0.SimFirstName} could do this all day - the floors will rue the day they tested {0.SimFirstName}'s resolve.

{0.SimFirstName} can't help but congratulate {M0.himself}{F0.herself} on finding a new way to clean {M0.his}{F0.her} toddler. Toddlers may throw a tantrum when it's bath time, but they find the whirring sounds and pull of the vacuum cleaner to be rather entertaining.
So friendly! So cute! But also... so dusty! They may help find a few Simoleons under the couch, but at the cost of your clean home.
Uh oh. You know you haven't done chores in a while when these critters appear. They're lean, they're mean, and unclean!

Small dust pile walks warily down the Lot
With its dusty self hanging low on the floor
Ain't no sound but the sound of its feet
Vacuum's ready to go

Are you ready hey are you ready for this?
Are you hanging on the edge of your seat?
Out of the doorway the Vacuums roll in
To the sound of the simlish beat ya!
Another dust to bust
Another dust to bust

And another one gone and another one gone
Another dust to bust
Hey all Sims are gonna get you too
Another dust to bust

This wonderous innovation in dust-removal technology removes dust from your home and transports it through a portal. We aren't authorized to say where the portal leads, but rest assured that you won't have to deal with it. That's the Gruntled Company promise.
The Debonair Dust Portal by Gruntled Inc.

Corral the dust bunnies in your home! Restore your home to its sparkling, spotless state with the Dust Dandy. This convenient lightweight vacuum can do the dirty work for you, letting you be dust bunny free for as long as possible. The Dust Dandy: It's not just great, it's just dandy!
Dust Dandy Cordless Vacuum by SuckUp Industries

Whisper quiet with a flexible design and our patented bag-less technology. This vacuum is the highest end way to give your home the deep-clean it deserves. If you ever split from your spouse, make sure you get this vacuum.
G7 Swivel Swank by Gruntled Inc.

The party's over, dust! This budget-friendly vacuum sucks, traps, and escorts dirt and debris safely away all without the high price tag. Patented hurricane-style technology ensures that only half the dust particles are violently blown back into the air, which is a fine track record for a previously owned refurbished model.
The Dusty Chaperone Upright Vacuum by SuckUp Industries

One of our largest and most intimidating models yet, the Dirt Herder 5000 is sure to trample any dust bunny, pile of errant crumbs, or any unwelcome pile in your home. Our innovative bag-less style of vacuum locks away dust and dirt in a special chamber which can be detached and easily released over any trash can. The future is here, and it sucks!
Dirt Herder 5000 Upright Vacuum by SuckUp Industries
{1.ObjectName} has already searched this area. Try again later.
Befriended Dust Bunnies will no longer disappear when a house becomes clean or filthy.
This Dust Bunny is not happy enough for you to befriend. Try feeding it dust and petting it!
{1.ObjectName} has already been fed a hearty meal of dust sprinklings.
Try to pet {1.ObjectName} in a little bit - right now this Dust Bunny prefers to frolick around your home and attract dust.
This Dust Bunny is not happy enough to be pet. Try feeding it some dust to cheer it up!
{0.SimFirstName} got a bit spooked the last time {M0.he}{F0.she} went near a Filth Fiend. For now it might be best to keep a safe distance...
{1.ObjectName} has already been bribed with it's favorite snack - a sprinkling of filth. Try again later.

{0.SimFirstName} did the seemingly impossible and befriended a Filth Fiend! Since {M0.he}{F0.she} made {M0.his}{F0.her} grimy companion feel so welcomed and cared for in {M0.his}{F0.her} house, this fiend will behave a bit differently. It can now survive in even the cleanest environments and will no longer be destroyed by cleaning around the house - it's here to stay. \n\nBefriended Filth Fiends have developed a peculiar sense of loyalty to their filth-ridden households. While they are still fussy, filth-kicking, havoc-wreaking balls of chaos, they will try their best to care for the Sims they have bonded with by occasionally rummaging up rare items, piles of simoleons, and questionable bits of food.
Only Sims who have completed the Fabulously Filthy Aspiration can befriend Filth Fiends
This Filth Fiend is too mischievious to befriend.
This Filth Fiend has already been befriended!
{1.ObjectName} has already been begged and pleaded with. Further negotiations at this time had better involve a filth snack...
{1.ObjectName} was too devious and intimidating to be stepped on, and is really agitated right now. Maybe it's best to try again later...
{1.ObjectName} was too intimidating to be pet and prefers to snarl, kick up dust, and be filthy . Maybe it's best to try again later...
Requires a Handheld Vacuum in Inventory
Remove as Favorite Handheld Vacuum Cleaner
Ensures that your vacuum is never full and will no longer overflow.
Using a self-charging battery, this Vacuum no longer costs power to run and will function Off-the-Grid.
Titanium Rotors ensure that your vacuum will never break, no matter how much dust it devours.
This upgrade causes your vacuum cleaner to emit a powerful electro-magnetic pulse which vaporizes nearby messes.
This vacuum is broken and needs to be repaired first
Leave out 3 plates or bowls of food until they get spoiled. Because that's how you get ants!
Let 3 Kitchen or Bathroom Objects Get Dirty
Neglect your kitchens and bathrooms. You'll clean them "tomorrow".
Let At Least One Floor Level of your Home Become Dirty
Make messes, procrastinate on cleaning, and let the dust keep building.
Max Out {0.SimFirstName}'s Fun Motive While on a Dusty, Dirty, or Filthy Floor

True masters of procrastination don't just avoid the task that should be done -- they replace those tasks with fun, and lots of it. Play video games, party, do anything other than deal with the mounting mess you call home.
Why do work when someone else will do it for you? Ask nicely or demand that they clean, that's up to you -- the important thing is that the job gets done (by someone else).
When your house is dusty or dirty, find a Dust Bunny and feed, pet, and befriend it.
Cook 3 Meals in a Dirty or Filthy Kitchen
Cook a meal on a dirty or filthy floor and learn to enjoy the special flavor the grossness adds to your food.
Sometimes you need things to be a bit cleaner, but you're still determined to dodge chores at all costs. Stick to your values and pay another Sim to clean your house from your phone or computer.
Let a floor level get filthy

Let a floor level get dusty, dirty, and finally filthy. If your Sim feels uncomfortable or tense around the escalating levels of filth and grime, remember that nearly every problem in life can be solved by lowering your standards.
Real filth connoisseurs have no qualms about a little mold. Leave out plates or bowls of food to spoil and eat them anyway.
Bathe or Shower 3 Times in a Dirty Shower or Tub
Let your shower or tub get really grimey and nasty from use - and use it anyway. Cleaning yourself is already more cleaning than any filth lover wants to do.
Don't Wash Your Hands After Using the Toilet
Why waste time washing your hands? Go straight from the toilet to shaking hands and cooking dinner. Nobody has to know.
Invite a Guest Over while House is Dirty or Filthy.
Using your phone or relationship panel, invite a friend to hang out. You may feel embarrassed, but push through that and learn to be proud of your filthy abode.
Fill up an outdoor trash can and in a fit of rage, knock it over to assert your dominance.
Throw a Party Social Event in a Filthy House
Let a household floor level get filthy and use your phone to throw a scheduled party event.
Appease a Filth Fiend with a Filth Tribute
Let your house get filthy enough for Filth Fiends to spawn and try to appease them with a filth tribute. Make them feel welcome in your filthy home!

Filth Dwellers have no shame and find love in the grimiest of places. Most Sims won't be in the mood for romance when they see the state of your home, but don't let that get you down. If they can't love you at your filthiest....
Become Very Happy (+3 or higher) on a Filthy Floor
Be one with your surroundings and find happiness amongst the deluge of dust and filth. By finding true happiness in the filth, you have learned what it means to be fabulously filthy.
Clean 3 kitchen or bathroom objects like sinks, stoves, bathtubs, or toilets.
Choose either a handheld or upright vacuum and enjoy harnessing the power of machines to eliminate dust from your carpets and floors.
Using the sink or dishwasher, wash or clean the dishes after a meal.
Perfectly Pristine Sims can't have sparkly clean floors with a stinking, heap of garbage in their kitchen trashcan. After the indoor trashcan fills up, take it out promptly.
Clean up 5 dust piles, puddles, pet poops, fur balls, toddler messes, or other undesirable household entities.

Don't be a savage. After using the bathroom, ensure your Sim makes a timely and thorough visit to the nearest sink. After a few hand-washings, your Sim will hopefully learn to always wash their hands.
Show Off Your Clean House to Guests
Invite a guest over from your relationship panel or phone and show them a clean floor level.
Being a proactive cleaner means continuing to clean even when things look clean. Keep cleaning and cleaning until your Sim's Perfectionist Zeal intensifies into its most potent, energized state.
Purchase a Handheld and Upright Vacuum
Vacuum Virtuosos need the finest in suctioning technology to slay dust. Purchase a handheld and upright vacuum from Build/Buy Mode .
Destroy 3 Dust Bunnies or Filth Fiends with Vacuum Cleaner

Let your house get dusty, dirty, or filthy. When Dust Bunnies or Filth Fiends emerge, ignore their cute charms and vacuum them up with heartless precision. On the road to pristine perfection, all manner of dust must be considered foes.
Destroy 5 Messy or Dust Pile Objects with Vacuum Cleaner
As dust piles and other messes emerge on the floor, destroy them with your trusty Vacuum Cleaner.
Perform 2 Upgrades on a Vacuum Cleaner

Gather parts and increase your handiness until you can successfully upgrade your vacuum cleaner. Modding your vacuum with a Bottomless Pit or a Vaporizing Pulse is the best way to flex on those other vacuum noobs that just use the stock models.

Designate a specific vacuum cleaner as your favorite. This vacuum cleaner will now be what your Sim prefers to use. This begins the deepest of bonds, the bond between a Sim and their prized vacuum cleaner.
Throw a Party Social Event in a Clean House

Keep your house clean and host a scheduled social event from your phone or calendar. A Birthday party, house party, dinner party, or similar party will do. If a house is clean, and no one else sees it, can it truly be considered clean?
Clean for 5 hours in a Happy, Confident, Inspired, or Focused Mood
Mastery of cleaning requires no longer seeing cleaning as a chore. Keep your Sim in a Happy, Confident, Inspired, or Focused mood and keep on cleaning or vacuuming.
Successfully Ask or Demand that Other Sims Clean 3 times

To be a Chief Cleaning Officer, you must know how to delegate. Your time is too valuable to be the only person in the household scrubbing toilets, mopping puddles, and vacuuming floors. Boss up your cleaning game and ask (or demand) that other household Sims get to cleaning!
Graduate from doing the cleaning yourself. By hiring a service from your phone or computer, you'll spend more time enjoying your clean house and less time actually cleaning.

Prevent messes before they happen. By upgrading stoves, ovens, or bathroom objects to be Self-Cleaning, you're saving yourself countless hours of future scrubbing. And when plumbing objects become unbreakable, they will no longer produce pesky puddles. The best way to clean is to not make a mess in the first place!
{0.SimFirstName} already has too many Dust Friends on this floor!

Sims don't get negative moodlets or lose fun while cleaning. Sim will clean at a more rapid pace and is more likely to become focused when cleaning, and for maximal cleaning efficiency, Fast & Fastidious Sims can use the "Power Clean" and "Power Vacuum" interactions.

This Sim no longer receives negative moodlets from living in dusty or messy environments. They loathe cleaning and love filth, and will receive Happy moodlets while in Dirty or Filthy houses. Additionally, they gain the ability to bond with and befriend Filth Fiends!
